body.body: Camshafts - Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection
Inspect the camshaft sprockets for damaged and worn teeth. Replace as necessary.

body.name: Camshafts - N Series - Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection (gaaa_13)

body.body: Locate the camshaft sprocket fixings through the slots on the sprockets. Tighten sufficiently to secure but to allow the sprocket to rotate.
Measure the camshaft journals with a micrometer. If any journal is outside the specified tolerance, replace the camshaft.

body.name: Camshafts - N Series - Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection (gabi)

body.body: Examine all camshaft and camshaft bearing caps for excessive wear and damage, paying particular attention to the camshaft cap (outrigger cap).
Check the journal-to-head clearances, using Plastigauge (Triumph part number 3880150-T0301) as follows:
Ensuring that the camshaft sprocket alignment marking is located as for removal, assemble one camshaft to the head and progressively tighten the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder to
Remove the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder using the fixing release sequence given earlier. Wipe the exposed areas of both the camshaft journal and a single cap or cap area of the ladder.
Apply a thin smear of grease to the journal and a small quantity of silicone release agent to the cap.
Size a length of the Plastigauge to fit across the camshaft journal. Fit the Plastigauge to the camshaft journal using the grease to hold the strip in place
Refit the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder then evenly and progressively tighten all the camshaft cap and ladder fixings to
in the correct sequence (see camshaft installation).
Release the cap fixings and remove the camshaft cap and camshaft ladder. Using the gauge provided with the Plastigauge kit, measure the width of the now compressed Plastigauge.

The camshaft cap and ladder are unique to each cylinder head and are, therefore, not available individually. If the camshaft cap or the ladder is worn or damaged, the complete cylinder head must be replaced.

body.name: Camshafts - N Series - Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection (ccrw)

body.body: Calculate the journal clearance using the Plastigauge chart supplied with the Plastigauge kit.
If the clearance measured is within the specified tolerance, remove the camshaft cap and camshaft ladder, and clean off all traces of Plastigauge.
If the measured clearance is outside the tolerance, and the camshaft journals are within tolerance, the cylinder head must be replaced.
Although Plastigauge is oil soluble, all traces of the material must be removed to prevent blockage of the oil drillings and resultant engine damage.

Inspect the camshaft sprockets for damaged and worn teeth. Replace as necessary.
Locate the camshaft sprocket fixings through the slots on the sprockets. Tighten sufficiently to secure but to allow the sprocket to rotate.
Measure the camshaft journals with a micrometer. If any journal is outside the specified tolerance, replace the camshaft.
Examine all camshaft and camshaft bearing caps for excessive wear and damage, paying particular attention to the camshaft cap (outrigger cap).
Check the journal-to-head clearances, using Plastigauge (Triumph part number 3880150-T0301) as follows:
Ensuring that the camshaft sprocket alignment marking is located as for removal, assemble one camshaft to the head and progressively tighten the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder to
Remove the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder using the fixing release sequence given earlier. Wipe the exposed areas of both the camshaft journal and a single cap or cap area of the ladder.

Refit the camshaft cap and camshaft cap ladder then evenly and progressively tighten all the camshaft cap and ladder fixings to
in the correct sequence (see camshaft installation).
Release the cap fixings and remove the camshaft cap and camshaft ladder. Using the gauge provided with the Plastigauge kit, measure the width of the now compressed Plastigauge.

The camshaft cap and ladder are unique to each cylinder head and are, therefore, not available individually. If the camshaft cap or the ladder is worn or damaged, the complete cylinder head must be replaced.
Calculate the journal clearance using the Plastigauge chart supplied with the Plastigauge kit.
If the clearance measured is within the specified tolerance, remove the camshaft cap and camshaft ladder, and clean off all traces of Plastigauge.
If the measured clearance is outside the tolerance, and the camshaft journals are within tolerance, the cylinder head must be replaced.
Although Plastigauge is oil soluble, all traces of the material must be removed to prevent blockage of the oil drillings and resultant engine damage.
title: Camshafts - Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection
